newsitem.title: FRANCE: Arthuis says France to freeze 10 bln Ffr spending.
newsitem.headline: Arthuis says France to freeze 10 bln Ffr spending.

text.p: The French government plans to freeze around 10 billion francs of 1997 spending as a "precaution" against budgetary overshoot, finance minister Jean Arthuis said on Thursday.
"The proposal to freeze credits will be ready soon. It will cover around 10 billion (francs)," Arthuis told a news briefing.
He declined to say which areas would be affected.

The government is aiming to limit the central government budget deficit to 285 billion francs in 1997 as part of an overall programme to reduce the total state deficit to three percent of gross domestic product.
In 1996 the central government budget deficit reached 295.4 billion francs, compared to 288 billion initially forecast, while the total state deficit reached an estimated 4.1 percent of GDP.
